experience_assessment: I have published one or two papers in this area.
review_assessment:_checking_correctness_: I assessed the sensibility of the derivations and theory.
I assessed the sensibility of the experiments.
title: Official Blind Review #1
review_assessment:_thoroughness_in_paper: I read the paper at least twice and used my best judgement in assessing the paper.
review:
This paper proposed an interesting idea that by regularizing the structure of the latent space into a sphere, we can free VAE from variantional inference framework.

However, here are several concerns about this paper:
1. is this a variant of the Wasserstein auto-encoder?
2. the image quality of VAE (CelebA) is not that bad in other VAE papers, maybe tuning the \beta-VAE can also achieve the same quantitative and qualitative results.
3. Can you visualize the latent space (z) for the CelebA dataset, also comparing with the results from VAE?
